alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 9:00AM CDT until July 12 at 2:22AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Harrah affecting Lincoln, Oklahoma and Pottawatomie Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Harrah. * WHEN...From this afternoon to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Look for short duration flooding of low-lying agricultural lands in eastern Oklahoma County... the southwest corner of Lincoln County... and northwestern Pottawatomie County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 14.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
